content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans! 

Let me start by getting oriented with the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /app</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">ls -la /app</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /app -type f -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" -o -name "*.txt" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">find /app -type f -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" -o -name "*.txt" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -R /app | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">ls -R /app | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Great! I'm warmed up and ready to work. I can see this is a repository with:

- A main branch with recent commits
- Several untracked directories: `.claude.json`, `projects/`, `shell-snapshots/`, `statsig/`, and `todos/`
- A git repository structure at `/app`

I'm in **read-only mode**, which means I can:
- Explore the codebase using `bash`, `read`, `glob`, and `grep`
- Understand existing patterns and architecture
- Design implementation plans
- Identify critical files for future implementation

I **cannot** and **will not**:
- Create, modify, or delete any files
- Run commands that change system state
- Use write operations of any kind

I'm ready to receive requirements and help you design implementation plans! Just provide me with:
1. The requirements or feature you want to implement
2. Optionally, a perspective or approach you'd like me to take

What would you like me to help plan?
